data.title: Waller County, Texas
data.text:
JURY DUTY FOR MONDAY, AUGUST 12,2024 AT THE HEMPSTEAD HIGH SCHOOL AUDITORIUM HAS BEEN CANCELLED. YOU ARE NO LONGER REQUIRED TO ATTEND. HAVE A WONDERFUL WEEKEND.

Waller County Court at Law Number Two

has the general jurisdiction of a Texas District Court AND a Texas County Court at Law.

The Local Board of Judges has assigned primary responsibility for the following cases to this court:

Most civil lawsuits previously handled by the 506th Judicial District Court except for tax cases and suits involving title to real estate.

All civil lawsuits previously handled by the Waller County Court at Law (now Waller County Court at Law Number One).

All family law cases ending in an even cause number except for cases filed by the Department of Family and Protective Services.

(ATTN: All uncontested cases filed under the Texas Estates Code on or after April 1, 2024, will be heard by

the Honorable Trey Duhon, Waller County Judge in the County Court of Waller County, Texas.

All contested cases filed under the Texas Estates Code will continue to be heard in County Court at Law Number Two.)

When in doubt about which court has your case, please consult the Court's Local Rules below or email the Court Coordinators.

ALL PROCEEDINGS ARE CONDUCTED IN PERSON

NO FURTHER ZOOM/REMOTE APPEARANCES WILL BE ALLOWED ABSENT COMPELLING REASONS

SUCH PERMISSION MUST BE OBTAINED FROM THE JUDGE PRIOR TO HEARING
